name: chemicalDatabase
description: The chemical database from which the data were obtained.

name: chemicalDataType
description: The type of chemical data in the dataset.

enumValues.description: The role of a molecular entity (protein or nucleic acid) that is the presumed subject of an assay and whose activity is being regulated by an entity with a perturbagen role in that assay.
A representation of the arrangement of atoms and bonds.
The chemical hashed fingerprint of a molecule is bit string (a sequence of 0 and 1 digits) that contains information on the structure.
A database with several types of chemical data
A chemical identifier is an identifier for a chemical entity

name: fingerprintType
description: The type of chemical fingerprint used.

enumValues.description: Considers paths of a given length. These are hashed fingerprints, with a default length of 1024.
Similar to the standard type, but takes rings and atomic properties into account into account.
The popular 166 bit MACCS keys described by MDL.
4860 bit fingerprint defined by Klekota and Roth.
An implementation of the ECFP6 fingerprint.
Specification for unambiguously describing the structure of a chemical compound using a short ASCII string.

A textual identifier for chemical substances designed to provide a standard and human-readable way to encode molecular information that also facilitates searches in printed and electronic data sources.
SDF is one of a family of chemical-data file formats developed by MDL Information Systems; it is intended especially for structural information.

name: chemicalStructure
description: A linear representation of the chemical structure (SMILES, SMARTS, InChI, InChIKey, etc). Note the format using structureFormat.
